Well assured that, notwithstanding the care and labor which he has bestowed upon it, his work is far from being faultless he yet submits it cheer· fully to the public, in the hope that it will be found not altogether unworthy to take a place in that . class of books, the general excellence of which is acquiring for them a well-deserved celebrity, and the importance of which can never be overrated — the books designed for the use of American schools and collegas.
